main event: On 1st April 1948, 1st Lt. Robert V. Meyers, a P-47 pilot in the Philippines, sighted an unidentified flying object (UFO) resembling a 30 feet wing-span, silver-colored aircraft. The UFO exhibited great acceleration and disappeared from sight in approximately 5 seconds.
interesting points: 1st Lt. Meyers was leading a flight of four P-47 aircraft when he sighted the UFO approximately 2-3 miles away, at an estimated altitude of 1,000-10,000 feet.
The UFO's shape was described as a half-moon resembling a flying wing type aircraft, with a barely perceptible dorsal fin, suggesting an unconventional design.
The UFO accelerated rapidly and disappeared from sight within 5 seconds, indicating advanced maneuverability and capabilities.
The report mentions that 1st Lt. Meyers was unable to contact his wingmen or other pilots due to their maneuvering, and his radio was out, indicating a lack of multiple witnesses to the incident.
The sighting was evaluated as a 'bird' by the Far East Air Forces Headquarters, indicating the perceived skepticism or dismissive attitude towards the UFO sighting.
sighted object: Unidentified triangular silver aircraft with a half-moon shape
witnesses: 1st Lt. Robert V. Meyers (reliable but single witness)
photographs: no photographs available in the report
